memberdef.name: rocsparse_scoomv

briefdescription.para: Sparse matrix vector multiplication using COO storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_coomv multiplies the scalar $\alpha$ with a sparse $m \times n$ matrix, defined in COO storage format, and the dense vector $x$ and adds the result to the dense vector $y$ that is multiplied by the scalar $\beta$, such that \[ y := \alpha \cdot op(A) \cdot x + \beta \cdot y, \] with \[ op(A) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} A, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_none} \\ A^T, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_transpose} \\ A^H, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_conjugate_transpose} \end{array} \right. \]
The COO matrix has to be sorted by row indices. This can be achieved by using rocsparse_coosort_by_row().

simplesect.para: This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.
Currently, only trans == rocsparse_operation_none is supported.

parameterdescription.para: handle to the rocsparse library context queue.
matrix operation type.
number of rows of the sparse COO matrix.
number of columns of the sparse COO matrix.
number of non-zero entries of the sparse COO matrix.
scalar $\alpha$.
descriptor of the sparse COO matrix. Currently, only rocsparse_matrix_type_general is supported.
array of nnz elements of the sparse COO matrix.
array of nnz elements containing the row indices of the sparse COO matrix.
array of nnz elements containing the column indices of the sparse COO matrix.
array of n elements ( $op(A) = A$) or m elements ( $op(A) = A^T$ or $op(A) = A^H$).
scalar $\beta$.
array of m elements ( $op(A) = A$) or n elements ( $op(A) = A^T$ or $op(A) = A^H$).
the operation completed successfully.
the library context was not initialized.
m, n or nnz is invalid.
descr, alpha, coo_val, coo_row_ind, coo_col_ind, x, beta or y pointer is invalid.
the device is not supported.
trans != rocsparse_operation_none or rocsparse_matrix_type != rocsparse_matrix_type_general.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsrmv

briefdescription.para: Sparse matrix vector multiplication using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrmv multiplies the scalar $\alpha$ with a sparse $m \times n$ matrix, defined in CSR storage format, and the dense vector $x$ and adds the result to the dense vector $y$ that is multiplied by the scalar $\beta$, such that \[ y := \alpha \cdot op(A) \cdot x + \beta \cdot y, \] with \[ op(A) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} A, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_none} \\ A^T, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_transpose} \\ A^H, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_conjugate_transpose} \end{array} \right. \]

The info parameter is optional and contains information collected by rocsparse_scsrmv_analysis() or rocsparse_dcsrmv_analysis(). If present, the information will be used to speed up the csrmv computation. If info == NULL, general csrmv routine will be used instead.

simplesect.para: This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.
Currently, only trans == rocsparse_operation_none is supported.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsrsv_buffer_size

briefdescription.para: Sparse triangular solve using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrsv_buffer_size returns the size of the temporary storage buffer that is required by rocsparse_scsrsv_analysis(), rocsparse_dcsrsv_analysis(), rocsparse_scsrsv_solve() and rocsparse_dcsrsv_solve(). The temporary storage buffer must be allocated by the user. The size of the temporary storage buffer is identical to the size returned by rocsparse_scsrilu0_buffer_size() and rocsparse_dcsrilu0_buffer_size() if the matrix sparsity pattern is identical. The user allocated buffer can thus be shared between subsequent calls to those functions.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsrsv_analysis

briefdescription.para: Sparse triangular solve using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrsv_analysis performs the analysis step for rocsparse_scsrsv_solve() and rocsparse_dcsrsv_solve(). It is expected that this function will be executed only once for a given matrix and particular operation type. The analysis meta data can be cleared by rocsparse_csrsv_clear().

rocsparse_csrsv_analysis can share its meta data with rocsparse_scsrilu0_analysis() and rocsparse_dcsrilu0_analysis(). Selecting rocsparse_analysis_policy_reuse policy can greatly improve computation performance of meta data. However, the user need to make sure that the sparsity pattern remains unchanged. If this cannot be assured, rocsparse_analysis_policy_force has to be used.

simplesect.para: If the matrix sparsity pattern changes, the gathered information will become invalid.
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsrsv_solve

briefdescription.para: Sparse triangular solve using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrsv_solve solves a sparse triangular linear system of a sparse $m \times m$ matrix, defined in CSR storage format, a dense solution vector $y$ and the right-hand side $x$ that is multiplied by $\alpha$, such that \[ op(A) \cdot y = \alpha \cdot x, \] with \[ op(A) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} A, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_none} \\ A^T, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_transpose} \\ A^H, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_conjugate_transpose} \end{array} \right. \]

rocsparse_csrsv_solve requires a user allocated temporary buffer. Its size is returned by rocsparse_scsrsv_buffer_size() or rocsparse_dcsrsv_buffer_size(). Furthermore, analysis meta data is required. It can be obtained by rocsparse_scsrsv_analysis() or rocsparse_dcsrsv_analysis(). rocsparse_csrsv_solve reports the first zero pivot (either numerical or structural zero). The zero pivot status can be checked calling rocsparse_csrsv_zero_pivot(). If rocsparse_diag_type == rocsparse_diag_type_unit, no zero pivot will be reported, even if $A_{j,j} = 0$ for some $j$.

simplesect.para: The sparse CSR matrix has to be sorted. This can be achieved by calling rocsparse_csrsort().
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.
Currently, only trans == rocsparse_operation_none is supported.

array of nnz elements containing the column indices of the sparse CSR matrix.
structure that holds the information collected during the analysis step.
array of m elements, holding the right-hand side.
array of m elements, holding the solution.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_shybmv

briefdescription.para: Sparse matrix vector multiplication using HYB storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_hybmv multiplies the scalar $\alpha$ with a sparse $m \times n$ matrix, defined in HYB storage format, and the dense vector $x$ and adds the result to the dense vector $y$ that is multiplied by the scalar $\beta$, such that \[ y := \alpha \cdot op(A) \cdot x + \beta \cdot y, \] with \[ op(A) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} A, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_none} \\ A^T, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_transpose} \\ A^H, & \text{if trans == rocsparse_operation_conjugate_transpose} \end{array} \right. \]

simplesect.para: This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.
Currently, only trans == rocsparse_operation_none is supported.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsrmm

briefdescription.para: Sparse matrix dense matrix multiplication using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrmm multiplies the scalar $\alpha$ with a sparse $m \times k$ matrix $A$, defined in CSR storage format, and the dense $k \times n$ matrix $B$ and adds the result to the dense $m \times n$ matrix $C$ that is multiplied by the scalar $\beta$, such that \[ C := \alpha \cdot op(A) \cdot op(B) + \beta \cdot C, \] with \[ op(A) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} A, & \text{if trans_A == rocsparse_operation_none} \\ A^T, & \text{if trans_A == rocsparse_operation_transpose} \\ A^H, & \text{if trans_A == rocsparse_operation_conjugate_transpose} \end{array} \right. \] and \[ op(B) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} B, & \text{if trans_B == rocsparse_operation_none} \\ B^T, & \text{if trans_B == rocsparse_operation_transpose} \\ B^H, & \text{if trans_B == rocsparse_operation_conjugate_transpose} \end{array} \right. \]

simplesect.para: This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.
Currently, only trans_A == rocsparse_operation_none is supported.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsrilu0_analysis

briefdescription.para: Incomplete LU factorization with 0 fill-ins and no pivoting using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrilu0_analysis performs the analysis step for rocsparse_scsrilu0() and rocsparse_dcsrilu0(). It is expected that this function will be executed only once for a given matrix and particular operation type. The analysis meta data can be cleared by rocsparse_csrilu0_clear().

rocsparse_csrilu0_analysis can share its meta data with rocsparse_scsrsv_analysis() and rocsparse_dcsrsv_analysis(). Selecting rocsparse_analysis_policy_reuse policy can greatly improve computation performance of meta data. However, the user need to make sure that the sparsity pattern remains unchanged. If this cannot be assured, rocsparse_analysis_policy_force has to be used.

simplesect.para: If the matrix sparsity pattern changes, the gathered information will become invalid.
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsrilu0

briefdescription.para: Incomplete LU factorization with 0 fill-ins and no pivoting using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrilu0 computes the incomplete LU factorization with 0 fill-ins and no pivoting of a sparse $m \times m$ CSR matrix $A$, such that \[ A \approx LU \]

rocsparse_csrilu0 requires a user allocated temporary buffer. Its size is returned by rocsparse_scsrilu0_buffer_size() or rocsparse_dcsrilu0_buffer_size(). Furthermore, analysis meta data is required. It can be obtained by rocsparse_scsrilu0_analysis() or rocsparse_dcsrilu0_analysis(). rocsparse_csrilu0 reports the first zero pivot (either numerical or structural zero). The zero pivot status can be obtained by calling rocsparse_csrilu0_zero_pivot().

simplesect.para: The sparse CSR matrix has to be sorted. This can be achieved by calling rocsparse_csrsort().
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

structure that holds the information collected during the analysis step.

temporary storage buffer allocated by the user.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsr2csc

briefdescription.para: Convert a sparse CSR matrix into a sparse CSC matrix.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csr2csc converts a CSR matrix into a CSC matrix. rocsparse_csr2csc can also be used to convert a CSC matrix into a CSR matrix. copy_values decides whether csc_val is being filled during conversion (rocsparse_action_numeric) or not (rocsparse_action_symbolic).
rocsparse_csr2csc requires extra temporary storage buffer that has to be allocated by the user. Storage buffer size can be determined by rocsparse_csr2csc_buffer_size().

simplesect.para: The resulting matrix can also be seen as the transpose of the input matrix.
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_scsr2ell

briefdescription.para: Convert a sparse CSR matrix into a sparse ELL matrix.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csr2ell converts a CSR matrix into an ELL matrix. It is assumed, that ell_val and ell_col_ind are allocated. Allocation size is computed by the number of rows times the number of ELL non-zero elements per row, such that $\text{nnz}_{\text{ELL}} = m \cdot \text{ell_width}$. The number of ELL non-zero elements per row is obtained by rocsparse_csr2ell_width().

memberdef.name: rocsparse_csrsv_zero_pivot

briefdescription.para: Sparse triangular solve using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrsv_zero_pivot returns rocsparse_status_zero_pivot, if either a structural or numerical zero has been found during rocsparse_scsrsv_solve() or rocsparse_dcsrsv_solve() computation. The first zero pivot $j$ at $A_{j,j}$ is stored in position, using same index base as the CSR matrix.
position can be in host or device memory. If no zero pivot has been found, position is set to -1 and rocsparse_status_success is returned instead.

simplesect.para: rocsparse_csrsv_zero_pivot is a blocking function. It might influence performance negatively.

parameterdescription.para: handle to the rocsparse library context queue.
descriptor of the sparse CSR matrix.
structure that holds the information collected during the analysis step.
pointer to zero pivot $j$, can be in host or device memory.
the operation completed successfully.
the library context was not initialized.
info or position pointer is invalid.
an internal error occurred.
zero pivot has been found.

memberdef.argsstring: (rocsparse_handle handle, const rocsparse_mat_descr descr, rocsparse_mat_info info)
memberdef.name: rocsparse_csrsv_clear

briefdescription.para: Sparse triangular solve using CSR storage format.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrsv_clear deallocates all memory that was allocated by rocsparse_scsrsv_analysis() or rocsparse_dcsrsv_analysis(). This is especially useful, if memory is an issue and the analysis data is not required for further computation, e.g. when switching to another sparse matrix format. Calling rocsparse_csrsv_clear is optional. All allocated resources will be cleared, when the opaque rocsparse_mat_info struct is destroyed using rocsparse_destroy_mat_info().

parameterdescription.para: handle to the rocsparse library context queue.
descriptor of the sparse CSR matrix.
structure that holds the information collected during the analysis step.
the operation completed successfully.
the library context was not initialized.
info pointer is invalid.
the buffer holding the meta data could not be deallocated.
an internal error occurred.

The first zero pivot $j$ at $A_{j,j}$ is stored in position, using same index base as the CSR matrix.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_csr2coo

briefdescription.para: Convert a sparse CSR matrix into a sparse COO matrix.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csr2coo converts the CSR array containing the row offsets, that point to the start of every row, into a COO array of row indices.

simplesect.para: It can also be used to convert a CSC array containing the column offsets into a COO array of column indices.
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

parameterdescription.para: handle to the rocsparse library context queue.
array of m+1 elements that point to the start of every row of the sparse CSR matrix.
number of non-zero entries of the sparse CSR matrix.
number of rows of the sparse CSR matrix.
array of nnz elements containing the row indices of the sparse COO matrix.
rocsparse_index_base_zero or rocsparse_index_base_one.
the operation completed successfully.
the library context was not initialized.
m or nnz is invalid.
csr_row_ptr or coo_row_ind pointer is invalid.
the device is not supported.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_coo2csr

briefdescription.para: Convert a sparse COO matrix into a sparse CSR matrix.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_coo2csr converts the COO array containing the row indices into a CSR array of row offsets, that point to the start of every row. It is assumed that the COO row index array is sorted.

simplesect.para: It can also be used, to convert a COO array containing the column indices into a CSC array of column offsets, that point to the start of every column. Then, it is assumed that the COO column index array is sorted, instead.
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

parameterdescription.para: handle to the rocsparse library context queue.
array of nnz elements containing the row indices of the sparse COO matrix.
number of non-zero entries of the sparse CSR matrix.
number of rows of the sparse CSR matrix.

rocsparse_index_base_zero or rocsparse_index_base_one.
the operation completed successfully.
the library context was not initialized.
m or nnz is invalid.
coo_row_ind or csr_row_ptr pointer is invalid.

simplesect.para: This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

memberdef.name: rocsparse_csrsort

briefdescription.para: Sort a sparse CSR matrix.

detaileddescription.para: rocsparse_csrsort sorts a matrix in CSR format. The sorted permutation vector perm can be used to obtain sorted csr_val array. In this case, perm must be initialized as the identity permutation, see rocsparse_create_identity_permutation().
rocsparse_csrsort requires extra temporary storage buffer that has to be allocated by the user. Storage buffer size can be determined by rocsparse_csrsort_buffer_size().

simplesect.para: perm can be NULL if a sorted permutation vector is not required.
This function is non blocking and executed asynchronously with respect to the host. It may return before the actual computation has finished.

parameterdescription.para: handle to the rocsparse library context queue.
number of rows of the sparse CSR matrix.
number of columns of the sparse CSR matrix.
number of non-zero entries of the sparse CSR matrix.
descriptor of the sparse CSR matrix. Currently, only rocsparse_matrix_type_general is supported.
array of m+1 elements that point to the start of every row of the sparse CSR matrix.
array of nnz elements containing the column indices of the sparse CSR matrix.
array of nnz integers containing the unsorted map indices, can be NULL.
temporary storage buffer allocated by the user, size is returned by rocsparse_csrsort_buffer_size().
the operation completed successfully.
the library context was not initialized.
m, n or nnz is invalid.
descr, csr_row_ptr, csr_col_ind or temp_buffer pointer is invalid.
an internal error occurred.
rocsparse_matrix_type != rocsparse_matrix_type_general.
